domain

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.util.Observable
      • domain.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends domain.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that represents the real world players in the game.
    Author:
    Team Pennybags
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
    Overview:
    Contains Player's needed information and properties. Responsible for money transactions of player.

      • decreaseMoney

        public boolean decreaseMoney(int money)
        Decrease this' totalMoney as the given amount money if this' totalMoney is enough.
        Parameters:
        money - The amount to decrease from player's total money.
        Returns:
        true if player is capable of paying and has paid to money, false otherwise.
        Effects:
        if this has enough money, this' money amount is decreased.
        Modifies:
        this

      • goToJail

        public void goToJail()
        Sets the inJail, jailTime attributes of this, changes the location of this' token.
        Requires:
        player and player's attached token are not null
        Effects:
        token's position, so that player, is set to the Jail position. player's jail time counter is set to the three. boolean field of player, inJail, for checking player is in jail or not is set to true.
        Modifies:
        this, Token

      • addCard

        public void addCard(domain.card.OwnableCard card)
        Adds the given card to the this' cards if the cards is not null. cards is created and the given card is added if the cards is null.
        Parameters:
        card - The card to be added to player's list of cards.
        Requires:
        an OwnableCard type of card which is not null
        Effects:
        if this' cards are null, addCard creates a new list. addCard adds card to this list.
        Modifies:
        this

      • removeCard

        Parameters:

        Returns:
